title: Netflix & Spotify Recommender Systems
text: Recommender Systems have become one of the cornerstones of this generation of technology companies. Through artificial intelligence algorithms, they have managed to know more about us than any human being is capable of understanding about oneself. In this talk we will see how a recommendation system works from the inside, how statistics help to put these algorithms into practice and real use cases of companies like Netflix, Spotify or Meta.

title: Recommendation Systems using holistic customer insights
text:
Commercialization of smartphones is a highly changing market where customers has the hard task to find a good quality-price relation in a ocean of possibilities. In this sense, we propose an innovate product able to help our customers select the best options based on their needs. From a technical perspective, we have been working in a system able to work with huge, real time data, with an online self-learning and with the possibility of not having historical information to learn about, i.e., with cold start. Algorithm is based on a Reinforcement Learning model called Contextual Multi-armed Bandit, used by Netflix in its frame’s content selection.
Otherwise, we wanted to add more value to the recommendation system adding the customer’s opinion based on Market Research techniques. We ask to our customers about smartphone preferences. The research was done online, using the Conjoint Analysis technique. Conjoint analysis allows the researcher to obtain the utility that customers give to different aspects in the purchase process, in this case, the smartphone selection. It also allows to explore the complete universe of possible mobile phones, not only those available in stock but any combination of device features. Then we use these utilities to enrich the output of the Reinforcement Learning algorithm.
Finally, we humanize the recommendation through a cognitive sentence generated by using NLP. As a result we offer our customers an awesome AI tool which can help them when they choose their next smartphones.

Experience & background


Leading data-driven decisions

For over a decade, I have been designing data & AI products that transform data into strategic business decisions. With experience in global tech companies such as Apple, I specialize in machine learning, statistical modeling, and creative data solutions, ensuring that data not only informs but drives long-term business impact and product innovation.
Currently, I lead data science initiatives at one of the world’s largest wedding marketplaces, applying Bayesian experimentation and causal inference to optimize user engagement and business growth. Beyond professional experience, I extended my background in Statistics to a Ph.D. in Stochastic Optimization & Differential Games, delving deeper in mathematical modeling and strategic problem-solving. As speaker & educator, my commitment is to make AI accessible to everyone and inspire others.

title: Key Strategies and Tools for Data Storytelling
text: In the era of Big Data, the ability to transform data into actionable insights is critical to business decision making. In this talk, we explore the essential principles of data visualization and review key tools that facilitate the creation of interactive reports and dashboards. We focus on practical tools such as Quarto, ideal for customizable and reproducible reports, and other data visualization and dynamic dashboard development tools. Throughout the session, we will learn how to leverage these platforms to communicate data clearly and effectively, optimizing the user experience and improving the impact of our reports.
